noun.description: A seductive spell or charm. Only in "to put the comether on someone" and variants: to exercise a powerful influence over someone; to persuade, fascinate, or seduce someone, especially of the opposite sex.

origin: Early 19th century; earliest use found in Sydney Morgan (bap. 1783, d. 1859), novelist and socialite. Representing a regional and colloquial pronunciation of come hither.
